pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [b1d1b3e17f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18416/commits/b1d1b3e17fda0db86a3c09b03fdf7260b08c8d50)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.LocalRing.ResidueField.Ideal` (new file)|1211|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Ideal.ResidueField`
`+ Ideal.ResidueField.map`
`+ Ideal.ResidueField.map‚Çê`
`+ Ideal.ResidueField.map‚Çê_apply`
`+ Ideal.algebraMap_residueField_eq_zero`
`+ Ideal.bijective_algebraMap_quotient_residueField`
`+ Ideal.injective_algebraMap_quotient_residueField`
`+ Ideal.ker_algebraMap_residueField`
`+ algebraMap_mk`
`+ instance : Algebra (R ‚ß∏ I) I.ResidueField`
`+ instance : IsFractionRing (R ‚ß∏ I) I.ResidueField`
`+ instance : IsScalarTower R (R ‚ß∏ I) I.ResidueField`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
Do you provide an isomorphism between this definition and simply `R/I` (without localizing)? I cannot find it. I am not saying that this should be the approach, but at least having the iso.

@faenuccio We have the `IsFractionRing (R ‚ß∏ I) I.ResidueField` instance. When `I` is maximal we have a field instance on `R ‚ß∏ I` so the isomorphism would come from general machinery about `IsFractionRing`. Or should I restate it here?

Oh I see, you probably have in mind `ringEquivOfRingEquiv`. In that case I agree it is not needed, perhaps you can add a line of doc close to the instance, pointing to the above `Equiv` in case someone needs it.
maintainer delegate
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by faenuccio.

Thanks!

bors merge

Build failed:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12415334127/job/34661460319)
@faenuccio I'm not sure if I understand what you meant but I added `Ideal.bijective_algebraMap_quotient_residueField` for maximal ideals and hopefully this is enough?

> @faenuccio I'm not sure if I understand what you meant but I added `Ideal.bijective_algebraMap_quotient_residueField` for maximal ideals and hopefully this is enough?

Yes, perfect! I think it's perfect to go.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12432860537/job/34713183670)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12432860537/job/34713183277)

This looks good to me. Could a commutative algebraist confirm?

maintainer merge?

This looks good to me. Could a commutative algebraist confirm?

maintainer merge?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory): the residue field of a prime ideal
